verses.roman:
pāṣaṇḍa-dalana-vānā nityānanda rāya
ācārya-huṅkāre pāpa-pāṣaṇḍī palāya

synonyms: pāṣaṇḍa-dalana—of trampling the atheists; vānā—having the feature; nityānanda—Lord Nityānanda; rāya—the honorable; ācārya—of Advaita Ācārya; huṅkāre—by the war cry; pāpa—sins; pāṣaṇḍī—and atheists; palāya—run away.
translation: Lord Nityānanda's very features indicate that He is the subduer of the unbelievers. All sins and unbelievers flee from the loud shouts of Advaita Ācārya.
